actual_logic: IP (Internet Protocol) is an important protocol for delivering data across networks. In IP, data is sent in packets, which include a header containing information for routing and a payload containing the data.
When a device wants to send data to another device they need to:
i) Get the destination IP address, which is used to locate the recipient in the network
ii) Routers find the optimal path to route data packets
iii) Data is often broken down into multiple data packets that are individually sent across a network in a process known as packet switching
iv) When packets reach the destination device, the device can process the data.
v) If there is an error in delivery, such as packets being lost or corrupted, there are mechanisms for recovery that can be used to ensure reliable delivery.
